Returns: The large icon for the car notification.
getLargeIcon().Description: Gets the large icon used in this car notification, or null if no icon has been set.

Parameters: Bitmap: The large icon to use in the car notification.
setLargeIcon(android.graphics.Bitmap).Description: Sets the large icon of the car notification. If no large icon is set in the extender, Android Auto will display the icon specified by @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setLargeIcon_E@

Parameters: Notification.Builder: the builder to be modified.
extend(android.app.Notification.Builder).Description: Apply car extensions to a notification that is being built. This is typically called by the @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#extend_E@ method of @B_android#app#Notification#Builder_E@.

getUnreadConversation().Description: Returns the unread conversation conveyed by this notification.

Parameters: Notification: The notification from which to copy options.
Notification.CarExtender(android.app.Not.Description: Create a @B_android#app#Notification#CarExtender_E@ from the CarExtender options of an existing Notification.

Parameters: Notification.CarExtender.UnreadConversation: The unread part of the conversation this notification conveys.
setUnreadConversation(android.app.Notifi.Description: Sets the unread conversation in a message notification.

setColor(int).Description: Sets the accent color to use when Android Auto presents the notification. Android Auto uses the color set with @B_android#app#Notification#Builder#setColor_E@ to accent the displayed notification. However, not all colors are acceptable in an automotive setting. This method can be used to override the color provided in the notification in such a situation.

ClassDesc: Helper class to add Android Auto extensions to notifications. To create a notification with car extensions: Car extensions can be accessed on an existing notification by using the CarExtender(Notification) constructor, and then using the get methods to access values.
